content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is a Julia solution:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = Dates.format.(df[:dt], "yyyymm")
end
```

This function takes in a DataFrame `df` and uses the `Dates.format` function to extract the year and month from each DateTime value in the column `dt`. The result is then assigned to the new column `ym`.

Note: This assumes that your DataFrame has already been converted into DateTime format (if not, you can convert it by using something like `df[:dt] = map(x->Date(string(x),"yyyymmdd"), df[:dt])`).
